caption: I’m here 7 months late because I want sweet potato fries and I remembered the last time I had them was here! The goat cheese fondue is the greatest pairing I’ve ever had and I came searching for a way to recreate it.  I’ve visit Chicago at least once a year and this was my first time visiting Uncommon Ground. The patio was absolutely gorgeous, the service was so great  and the food was even better. This was also my husband’s first trip to the city and this was his favorite spot we visited, he loved the beer (and his burger)! We can’t wait to come back again!
Good food excellent beer! The patio was awesome!
We had a great time and a great meal at Uncommon Ground on Clark. We sat in their tent with a heater and were warm. Plus our waitress, Savannah took good care of us.

The food is always good, that's not the issue. The space is cool, that's not the issue. The issue is with the wait staff. I have been regularly coming in (once or twice a month for over five years), and the staff has really gone down hill over the past year.  I have placed pickups orders and been told to come over in 20 minutes, and it really takes closer to an hour so you stand there waiting. While you wait, you would think they could get you your bill so you can pay and be on your way when the food arrives, but instead you wait to pay after your food arrives.  I have sat at the bar, with an empty water glass, an empty beer glass and an empty plate, waiting for the bartender to come back to me. Instead of refilling my water, asking if I wanted another beer (I did) or clearing my plate, the bartender and several other staff members were fawning over the owner of the Metro theater who was in as well.  It seems like they need new management or some servers who can avoid making simple mistakes (like ordering chilaquiles without chorizo and having them arrive with chorizo).
Great food, beer, and friendly service.
Great food and staff

First time here since pandemic started and we enjoyed great brunch, service and hot toddies that kept us plenty warm in the outdoor dining area! Definitely will be back again soon and really appreciated how responsible the UG team was with social distancing spacing and masking up.

Been anticipating coming here for months and WOW WOW WOW!!! Amazing food, amazing service and very Covid strict. Thank you, Savannah, for the best service and thank you to the kitchen staff for perfect poached eggs! Can’t wait to make y’all a habit!

Brunch and lunch menus available...had the delicious veggie hash and the special scramble of the day.  Crispy potatoes are awesome....sitting in the sun was perfect even on a 45 degree day.  Service from Brendan was spot on.
Love UG! They serve up delicious food and fab organic beer👍 and during the pandemic they are being super attentive following guidelines and keeping everyone safe.

Nice atmosphere, cocktails and service was good, but the food was, sadly, not great. Shiitake mushroom risotto was very rich, but didn't taste of much and the pumpkin ravioli, while having potential for being good, were so oily that I cannot bring myself to give even four stars. Artichoke, goat cheese & pesto dip and apple cinnamon cobbler were alright, but not great.
Great service and food!
Service was awesome.  The food was delicious.  Only recommendation would be outside heaters for cool nights.  Would definitely go back again.
Great selection of food and drinks.

It was a terrible experience. Me and my friend were waiting for two vegan burgers for 40 minutes. Waiter didn’t want to show up because he didn’t want us to ask any questions. When we finally got our food it was cold, and also there was no sauce in a vegan burger so it’s really dry (remember, it’s also cold). Other location way way better, but I will never come back to this one.

We have been customers of Uncommon off and on since before any of the current staff were born. At it's best, it's a quirky blend of bistro food, and a granola atmosphere. In those times, the staff ranged from hippie to hipster, who liked to talk about philosophy between courses At it's worst, the high turnover of chefs and waitstaff produce an opening night vibe of lack of training and hospitality. That's where we are now.  Recently, a hostess told us we had one hour to eat, then failed to offer to take a drink order. Some of the staff implement the covid rules by sneaking up on the table, stomping their foot, like a Queen's grenadier guard punctuating his 12 foot march in front of the palace, and rolling their eyes to show the customer that it's an imposition on the server to wait two seconds while the customer fumbles with his mask.  Last night our waitress was rude, argumentative, and impatient. She literally threw things on the table, not in an assaultive way, but to make sure everybody knew she was in a bad mood, putting a pall over our evening. This isn't just an issue of an individual. We are regulars at a number of restaurants, and staff can't get away with acting like this. Twenty something servers  are not Red Guards on a mission to train their elders.  Although the front of the house is the main problem right now, it's worth mentioning that we could use an occasional interesting new appetizer, like the hippie egg rolls we had a few months ago. Helen's Chicken is fine, and the chili remains excellent, but the lack of anything new just reinforces the impression of an angry and unhappy zombie march through covid.

Follows CDC guidelines carefully.   Thoughtful and delicious menu and very good service.   Highly recommend fried tomato sandwich,  sweet potato fries, veggie chili, chopped salad,  and artichoke  dip.
Great beer (the new Pilsner). Piri piri chicken was super moist - best brined breast I’ve had in years.

Let me be clear up front. I’ve served in restaurants and am an incredibly easy going, understanding person when it comes to service and dining out. I had an awful experience here tonight. I had been wanting to try Uncommon Ground for awhile now. I live in the neighborhood. My boyfriend and I got off work late and knew to call ahead to make sure when the kitchen closed, which was 10. We showed up at 9:15 pm full prepared to order right away. When the server came around after introducing himself, we were immediately ready to order. 2 beers, 1 app and 2 entrees. We waited and chatted. It got to be 10 pm. No beer has arrived. No water refills. No table visit, except to tell me that the side I ordered 40 minutes ago (mac n cheese) was out. Oh ok no problem. Can I have fries instead? Oh I’m sorry our kitchen is closed ...(?) Then, why did you wait until 10 pm to tell me this? App arrives (sweet fries with goat cheese) **still no beer** then he comes back with our entrees. I ordered the black bean burger and my bf got a beef burger. Neither of us finished ( and we were hungry) Everything was dry and lacked flavor. It was like they made the worst meal on purpose. We got the check. And you know what? I paid in full. I know restaurants are suffering right now. I paid $50 for my mediocre appetizer and awful entrees. But I want the owner of this establishment to read this. The service and food I had tonight (after wanting to eat here for some time) was so disappointing that I wish I could get a refund. Please hire more attentive staff that care about their jobs. I was in the best mood, ready to enjoy my Friday. And this experience soured the whole evening.
Great brunch place and good for groups

If you dined at this restaurant anytime between July 10th-13th a server tested positive for coronavirus, please go get tested for covid if you have experience any symptoms. This restaurant has still decided to stay open even though one of their workers tested positive which isn’t right at all.Plus they didn’t notify any of their other staff that the server tested positive. Now the rest of the staff have taken it upon themselves to get tested.So please don’t go to the restaurant at all because they’re not taking this pandemic seriously.
Always a great place for a beer wine and excellent lunch or dinner 😋

The server was sweet, the host was a little to stufffy and fake for me. The food portion on the “small” salad wasn’t worth $8. My son’s kids burger and fries was cold and soggy. Very unwelcoming place. And that’s too bad because i work across the street and was hoping to refer people .
Great food and service. Bacon wrapped meatloaf was delicious.

GREAT neighborhood spot. Delicious food and beer! This restaurant is 2 blocks from my apartment and we’ve wanted to try it forever... definitely going to be a go-to for us now. I got the pulled pork tacos and my husband got the meatloaf. I would never think to order meatloaf at a restaurant but it was phenomenal.  Staff is super nice and the patio is dog friendly. Tables were very well spaced out to accommodate social distancing. Will definitely be going back soon!

First time out to eat since everything closed down and it was the most enjoyable experience! Felt very comfortably spaced out and enjoyed the outdoor seating. Great food and service and had fun taking home a growler.
I bought small small salade  like kids meal ,it’s not even a salad (dandilion greens , pea ,<salmon : length 5 inch and width 0,5 inch ).   for 25.47 dollars
Great coffee and great example of social distancing
Great beer

I had made a dinner reservation for a show.  Several days before, I got a call stating that the show reservations were moving faster than expected, so it would now be advance tickets only.  When I called back, the show was already sold out.  However, the person on the phone told me we would be accommodated.  However, when we arrived, we were turned away, regardless of this commitment.  While the talent booked is fine, the food is middle of the road, and the location inconvenient.  It's not enough to go back for.  We won't return.  UPDATE:  Only part of the he response below is correct - we were only told that we could wait to see if there were no shows - no offer of a drink on the house orvothers waiting.  When I spoke to the venue on the phone the day before, I was told we would be accommodated.  In addition, I had responded to a text that afternoon confirming our dinner reservation for the show, something not acknowledged.  While we appreciate the offer of complementary show tickets, it's unlikely we'll return.
Cute place and its kind of pricey but absolutely terrible food. Like yuck. At least dont get the grilled cheese and tomato soup if you must go. My friend didnt like her Vegan hash either.
I really like their food and customer service, good area right next to where I live. The staff members are always nice. I highly recommend this place.

I was disappointed with the "smash" burger. It seems as though it was 2 frozen patties not fresh beef, certainly didn't seem smashed. The side salad dressing was very oily, not enough vinegar. I had to salt it but it still didn't taste that great.

I celebrated my nomination last night in this great restaurant. happy to tell that we passed a wonderful evening and the place was certainly one of the reasons for the strong evening. The team  contributed in a pleasant way, the meals were appetizing and my buddies were extremely  overjoyed. We shall definitely visit again for more events. thanks very much.
Helen's grilled chicken sandwich and a bloody mary is my go-to. They infuse vodka with garlic, peppers, and other deliciousness on site and this makes it my favorite bloody mary I've had in Chicago.

My husband's smash burger was microwaved and tasted off because of that. I would have expected better for a $15 burger. It should have been refired if it got cold for some reason during prep.  The beer was very good, but disappointed in the food prep.
Had an incredible server. The food was very good. I had the meatloaf and loved it. Others said theirs was a bit salty so sharing just for info. Prices were reasonable too.
Great brunch place with HUGE portions and what is the only organic brewery in the state! Tried the chilaquiles and the beermosa Will need to return to  try more of the beer list.

Very cool place. The service is friendly and I had a fun night there. The live music room was a very cool way to still have a venue to live music but not to let it overflow into the main bar area. I had a great time there.

Our family comes from all over the country each year on November 15th and gathers outside Wrigley Field to honor my late mother. After a round at our favorite Wrigleyville watering holes, we always come up to Uncommon Ground, thanks to a suggestion we got from thr staff at Sluggers a few years ago. We just had our fourth gathering Friday and had a wonderful time as always. You all were very accomodating for our large group and the food was perfect. Thanks for being part of our tradition and for helping us celebrate family in such a great way.
Total rip off. I ordered Steak and eggs. It was eggs and potatoes. I got 2 little pieces of meat. Total rip off for 17 bucks.
Love the food here, the beers compliment each dish here. Customer service can use some work but the food is delicious

5 years after our original Visit... We’ve been back many a time, met Hozier Here, had cheese curds multiple times. The Bar Tender from that first visit is long gone & noticed tonight that they have new Light Fixtures & have to agree on the service situation. We sat at the bar and the poor guy behind the counter seemed super overwhelmed. Didn’t get a menu for 5+ minutes after taking a seat. That and Lackluster food quality result in a downgraded review from 5* to 4*  2014 review: We came in here randomly after watching a performance at the Public House Theater down the street one frigid winter day & were immediately impressed by the decor and staff. We took a seat at the bar and struck up a conversation with the bar tender, Lee.  He's an impressive guy - does all their infusions & know SOOO much about beer. Very cool guy. He's remembered us in subsequent visits.  The food is tasty as well - we've mostly had the apps, not the entrees, but they do Cheese Curds really well. On top of that, they have a very impressive beer list and great space. Live music on the weekends in a room of the main section and a big seating area in the back.

Very slow and inattentive service. We arrived at noon and ordered about 12:15. The first two plates finally came out at 1. Their food was lukewarm/cold. While we were waiting for the rest of our food, the table that arrived after us got their food. Then we had to wait about 10 minutes for the next two plates to come out, also lukewarm. Then we waited another 5 minutes for the last two meals, one of which was brought out incorrectly. Our waiter hardly ever visited our table.  The bright spot in all of this was that the manager finally got us all of our food and apologized for the issues. He put the entire meal was on the house. The food itself was pretty decent.

I can’t say enough about this place. We have been talking about trying it for a while, and once we received a coupon for donating to public radio, it was the perfect chance. We went a little crazy because everything on the menu looked good, and everything was perfect. We started with the miso cauliflower, which was super tasty. My husband had the short rib and I had the Amish chicken, and we couldn’t decide which was better because both were delicious. The manager and server were both super attentive and helpful, making the entire visit perfect. And to make it better, their sister restaurant has the first certified organic rooftop garden in the country, so you know the produce is as good as it gets.
Great place to meet with friends and share a meal. Great digital art display by Gary Gantert Photography.
Staff was friendly and cater well to allergies. Though they served cold, soggy old fries on my initial plate but they did replace with a new order. Menu is pretty expensive though.

I just don't get this place. I have given it 3 chances and each time it fails differently. The first time I get a really tough steak with a butter knife. Took a while to flag down a server, but ultimately rectified the situation. The second time we went for beers and sat so long the manager had to tell the bartender to serve us. The third time we sat outside at a rickety table and we weren't acknowledged by a server. Bus boy came by and said we would have a server come over and nothing for another 5 minutes on a Friday night with ample staff. We got up and left. I love the idea of this place but man it can fall short sometimes.

My goodness this was amazingly delicious! I had the grass fed chimichurri steak with grilled shishito peppers and grilled corn and I honestly don’t know how they could have improved on the dish. Absolutely perfect.
I never thought about putting chorizo in Mac and Cheese but now I don't know if I'll ever be able to have it without it now. The beer and atmosphere were also great.

Excellent selection of fresh, delicious foods!   Love the collaboration with Green Star Brewing.     We shared a chopped salad and green star bbq chicken with fresh vegetables, which was more than enough for two.   Friendly s attentive service.

We stopped here before the Cubs game for a healthy lunch. We sat on the patio,  which is dog friendly! My fiance got a salad and I got the Turkey club with side salad.  The service was fast, and the food was very fresh and delicious. I would definately come back again.
Disgrace

Great local pub that focuses on quality.  Great food,  excellent bar staff,  events regularly.  My first visit happened to line up with tour times for Greenstar Brewery so I was able to meet their brewmaster and learn more about organic beer.  Great for brunch,  dining alone or events.  Uncommon Ground is worth checking out.
Great food, good service and nice atmosphere
Love food, loved ambience. Great spot for lunch.

Walked in on a Friday night around 9pm, no one up front no one behind the bar waited up front for 10 minutes nothing, called the business phone number and a female sitting at the bar with other customers looked over drank her beer and after some time answered, she was rude,unprofessional, our party were treated unwelcome and unwanted

First time going there. We went on a Tuesday night. The drinks were great. However we placed an order for dinner right away. Ended up waiting 40 mins for our food. The waiter was no where to be seen. It look like he was serving a bigger party and we were left behind. I had to ask for the hostess for our food. Server apologize,  he was too late. I am very unsatisfied and won't be going back.
Great stuff

I'm gonna call this just an average third wave coffee shop/restaurant with a performance stage included. It's clean, it's classy, it has a good ginger ale. I was there to see a friend performing a show. I liked the show, but the rest was so forgettable that I forgot I was ever there until Google reminded me I hadn't reviewed it. I think everyone has a different idea of what they are looking for in a restaurant/venue, so if you're a Wicker Park living craft beer drinking Tom's Shoes wearing Brandi Carlisle listening type of fella, I think you'll like it. No disrespect to Brandi Carlisle, she's dope AF.
The atmosphere is great! Love the food and the selection
Who tf charges $17 for a burger. Relax.
Ordered a hamburger and it was not great.
I had my birthday brunch her with my girlfriends, about 10 of us. Great service, great food, great mission. It was perfect!

Went here for brunch and it was beyond amazing. Got the cold and flu buster drink and the Neal Cassidy and both were amazing, also great presentation. The food was spectacular, got the ham french toast and the veggie hash, some of the best and healthiest/organic breakfast we've had in the city. Will be coming back!

First, generally the food is mediocre and overpriced. Normally, would have received 3 (maybe 4 if everything else was amazing) stars from me. I'm giving 1 star though because of the service. I went with my girlfriend who is vegetarian and ordered a cauliflower dish. As she was eating, she found a piece of chicken in it (looked like it fell in from another dish). I (a meat eater) tasted it and confirmed. Not a big deal, it happens. She was disgusted and asked them if they could remake it. The waitress was very apologetic and took the chicken piece back. The manager came out a few minutes later and said he looked at the piece and it wasn't chicken, but overcooked cauliflower. That's why they're getting a one star rating. Don't try to lie to your customers. I eat chicken, I eat cauliflower, and overcooked cauliflower doesn't take on the texture and flavor of chicken (I'd be eating a lot more cauliflower if it did).  Side note, I had the burger. It was nothing special. For a much better (and cheaper) burger with way better service, head down one block to Mordecai's.

Uncommon Ground is an unique element of live entertainment. If you don't like young adults with their own energy that translates into music of the contemporary jazz genre and infused with rap and poetry, stay home and watch reruns. But if you are curious about what our college students and graduates are about, if your ear can appreciate grassroots old school jam sessions where talented musicians drop in and lend their appreciable skills to the blend with  contemporary twists of creativity. And food, yes food and drink that breaks the chain of common place wannabe  establishments then I invite you to treat yourself and friends to a good atmosphere of relaxation with respect to yourselves and enjoyments of music, food and drinks. I would say more, but it would be uncommon of me to tell all. Bye4now G.
Menu is small but the food was good. Staff were friendly. Our waiter was very good. Excellent jazz.

The first time I came here was just for take out and I got chilaquiles, which was pretty good for a non-Mexican restaurant. The next time I came was with my gf and we dined in for lunch. For an appetizer we ordered the calamari, which, hence the restaurant’s name, was uncommon, but still DELICIOUS. (There were too many commas in that sentence. I know I know.) Whatever the squid was marinated in made it probably the best calamari we’ve ever had. I ordered the mac-n-cheese, but it wasn’t the best at all. She ordered fish tacos and those weren’t appetizing as well. We also ordered a couple alcoholic drinks, but they were completely watered down. 🤷🏽‍♂️
Great spot for music, good food
Great place for good food and local music😄
Coffee was good, but $3 a cup. I wasn't trying to impress anyone, just needed a hot coffee to warm up.
I would give this place 10 Stars amazing food amazing service!!!!

The food was delicious. Flavors popped from inspired pairings. The local IPA hit the sweet spot (for me) on both hops and citrus. [I didn't give the last star because service was just Ok, and it was not very crowded.]
The food was bleh. Nothing about it justified paying so much money for it.
Good food. Clean place.
Delicious! Great coffee, loads of vegan and veg options, and apparently the chimichurri steak was amazing.
Ist impression was just ok. I need to return to develop a real opinion.

This used to be one of our go-to places for either a date night or to take out of town guests to.  I love the concept of the restaurant and their support of sustainability and keeping a lot of their ingredients local.  Last night we went to celebrate our two-year anniversary there, partially because of the history we have with the restaurant, partially because a lot of restaurants are closed on Mondays and partially because we were planning last minute.  All I can say is that in general the food is very good – interesting, wide variety and range of price points.  The service though seems to get worse and worse every time we go.  Last night our service was subpar.  We let them know ahead of time it was a special occasion but no recognition of that from the host or server.  We were placed at a table where we could see the kitchen and clearly the staff just wanted to go home (we were a 7:45 pm reservation and not the last people there).  There was two different types of music playing at the same time – I think from the kitchen and then in the restaurant which was distracting and acoustically annoying.  The kitchen staff kept coming out to watch the game which is fine, except with the overall servers and host being nonchalant and not engaging about everything, it definitely came off the wrong way – as in “Please finish up your food so we can go home”.  I want to continue to love uncommon ground but at this point I’m not sure if it’ll be on my list for restaurants anymore.
Too noisy
Best chicken and waffles I’ve ever had. The buzzy bee latte changed my life. I now make my lattes with honey.
Great ambiance and food. Try something you don't normally get. Waffle and chicken was amazing. Enough for 2.
Great food and drinks. Gluten free and vegan options.
Delicious food! Even tried their vegan chorizo (not sure if that’s on the menu anymore), which was amazing. Great place to get a bite before stopping at the Metro Chicago for a concert!
The meatloaf is incredible.
Great food, can be noisy, especially after a Cubs game
Nice atmophere and good food
Love this place
Food was very good, service was excellent!

Stopped in before a Cubs game on a Saturday night. W needed both vegan and gluten free options and this place accommodated to both with several options. I split the smash burger and pork tacos with my son and both were great. My wife(G.Free) had the shrimp tacos and my daughter(vegan) said this was the best impossible burger she has had to date. The fries were great as well. Beer selection is great too. Highly recommended next time you are in Wrigleyville. Just a short walk from the Friendly Confines.
Awesome food and service.
Was not happy with the steak freitis, steak was  so to tuff. $25 so not worth it.

Organic, humane and local they do all 3 and are 5 stars in my book. Food people serving up farm raised hard work! I like that I can feel good about and enjoy going out to eat when I go there. Like the sunshine salad, and if I am decadent and they have it, any of their flavors of breadpudding are delicious. My son loves the burgers and I will sometimes have a bite. My dog loves the patio, we sometimes go after a baseball game or the dog park and hit the one in Devon too.
Noisy and lively. Good food, a tad overpriced.
Excellent service. No wait for weekday lunch.  Accommodating for our baby, and for food allergies. Oh, and the food was awesome!
The food was very expensive, and not good.
Highly recommend the brussel sprouts and bacon wrapped meatloaf!
Always delivers on beer and comfort food. Service was pretty good.

Vibe was cool. Show phenomenal (Amanda Brown was headline) food could have been better. Fries were overcooked and hard and grass fed hamburgers were dry. Enjoyed my time will they again. Staff was fantastic

Uncommon Ground used to be a great spot to dine.  The last few times I've been here, it's evident that the overall quality is lost on it's popularity.  The service and the food were both subpar.  The "steak & eggs" came out in less than 5 minutes, which obviously means it was pre-cooked and heated up.  It was watery and tasteless.  Ordered it medium and it came out rare and swimming in liquid.  When mentioning to the waiter that the taste was not pleasing, he went to the kitchen and came back with some aioli sauce!   In addition, our order of chilaquiles was dry and mainly chips; barely any eggs whatsoever.   Waiter immediately brought us our check as if he just wanted to get it over with;  never asked if we wanted more coffee or anything else.  $57 brunch for 2 = Sunday afternoon regret.  I remember a time when this place served up quality eats with great service.  I won't be returning to UG again.  Major disappointment.
Met friends for appetizers, burger and drinks on the patio. The food was fresh and service fast.

Unwelcoming  hostess ruined early Fathers Day brunch for us. Evaluation is not for food (we wanted to leave ASAP), just for experience. It was our fault in situation as well, but hostess could't  control herself and gave us too many of her "lessons".  Fortunately, there are many other restaurants around.
Beautiful artwork and wait staff😉
Great food and service.

I used to like this restaurant, but I went in last night before a concert and my wife who is Celiac, not just gluten free,  we told the server this and asked him about the gluten-free dishes on the menu which are clearly marked (in red) “gluten free” .  We ordered the brussels sprouts which are marked as a gluten-free option on the menu (in red letters) and after my wife started eating it he came over to tell us that they only use one fryer for everything....  which means it’s far from gluten free.  I’m grateful he told us, I’m very disappointed that the kitchen could care less about people with food sensitivities by marking things GF and using one frier for everything...The bearded trendy server was so nonchalant about telling us...
Their grilled cheese and tomato soup were very good! Crispy break and gooey cheese! The restaurant was funkily decorated and had a nice vibe. Will definitely return to try out the rest of their menu.
It's definitely a little more pricey, but their breakfast chilaquiles were amazing. I would also recommend their breakfast potatoes, and the other vegan dish.
Food really eh especially for around $20 a dish. Not really any flavor in either entree

You must order the Sauteed Wild Mushrooms with Fried Polenta and the Big Fork Bacon Sausage with Caramelized Onions and Red Peppers--you will not be disappointed! Later in the night, my friend and I enjoyed the Royce Lovett opening performance and the Ethan Butler acoustic show in the Clark Street Music Room. Such crazy talent and savory foods! Stellar evening at Uncommon Ground--thank you!!!
Really good looking and tasting food.
Great food, Lovely service. Had a great time!

Very good food. Had a bit of a hiccup being seated during Sunday brunch (even though there were tables  available) and they ironed it out eventually. It was very loud in the bar and north room so we sat in the west room and that was quiet enough that my spouse and I could hear each other. We both ordered the root veggie hash with and egg and it was very good. The unicorn tears hot sauce was very nice. We had a Belgium waffle Sunday and also coffee. The bill was kind of up there for breakfast but we did this on a whim and chalk it up to experience and were very satisfied with the food. The server was very nice and professional and the food came fast and hot. The coffee was strong and  fresh and good, much better than most restaurant coffee. I recommend, however, it is not an inexpensive breakfast. I will say that the veggie and vegan options make the price almost worth it, but I can get relatively the same food at Pick Me Up Cafe for half the cost and I'm pretty sure Chicago Diner is also cheaper. This is very good, gourmet bar food, but you're not getting out for a bargain price if that's a factor.
Great local venue for live music
Excellent coffee, and a pleasant alternative to the green monster.
Great atmosphere, service, food, and the beer is pretty dang good too! Enjoy!

My wife and I found our way here last night to eat and hear Spectators, Noa Jordan, and The Daily Fare.  Comfortable like back home in Fayetteville. The bands (new to us) were friendly, personable, and approachable. Great place and a great time.

An outstanding place for quality food that's fairly affordable, without being too fancy. For music, this is probably Chicago's premier venue for songwriters and offers a fantastic listening room for them.
Organic, tasty foods with no junk in them, and great craft beers. Families seem to really like this place too.
I love Michael Cameron
Food used to be great, but after today’s visit it seemed like cheaper ingredients. The egg in my sandwich looked like it was from McDonald’s. I hope they change back to how it used to be....
Super dope
Amazing food, great service, nice atmosphere. Kid friendly.
Awesome place! It's got a nice ambiance with a real fireplace, but it's a bit bright.
Super wonderful side burns
Amazing food, great service, loved the art on the walls. Next time will come hear live music!
Great atmosphere, not many low carb options, but we had a salad and steak, which was amazing. Need to find more excuses to come to Chicago, just for this restaurant.
Nice place. Decent meals. Reasonable portions. Wife really liked the fried green tomato sandwich.
The food was ok, the service was below average
Great brunch!
Delicious food and home grown herbs,  very friendly staff, you MUST order a side of the waffle with the berry compote.
Mediocre food at best, no vibe.
Biscuits & Gravy oh yeah
Terrible. Bland, over priced food, slow service. No water was brought to the table. I requested iced tea and got hot tea.  They were polite, however.  Skip this place and go somewhere better.

Amazing laid back date night experience. The place is really well set up with great art and lighting and seating. Great venue for live music and open mic performances. Mitch served us at the bar and he gave exceptional service and the welcoming host was accommodating as well.
Had a beer after concert.  Staff were friendly.  Will stop by again
Delicious amd funky. Great service.
.k
The food is healthy but pretty bland

Overall: Good food and great atmosphere, just wish there were more options and less $$.  The good: The ambience of the entire restaurant is really cool, with a lot of artistic decorcations and lighting. The service was very friendly and attentive and helpful with the menu. The food is good, with appropriate portion sizes and fresh ingredients. Nice patio  The not-so-good: To be blunt, it's too expensive. The food was good but not great, and certainly didn't warrant the prices they had. My dad had two eggs, potatoes, and toast, and it was $15. That's absurd. The menu is interesting, but there aren't a ton of options on it.  Atmosphere: 9/10 Service: 8/10 Food: 7/10
Get reservations got there on time you go in there and they said they're out of ribs. They gave us 15% off coupons they were expired

This restaurant offers a variety of beers and local ingredients in all their dishes!  We paid this place a visit for a late brunch/lunch and got seated promptly. I ordered the lemonade once I knew this was the farm to table kind of place. Let me just say i didn't disappoint!! It was definitely the perfect drink for a hot summer day in Chicago.  For food, I ordered the roasted red pepper sandwich. The portions are pretty generous here - so come really hungry or ready to pack the rest of your meal to go.  The quality of the ingredients were fresh and rich. I loved every bite of my food - although my plate probably said otherwise. My stomach got the best of me and I definitely hit my food coma faster than I thought. Probably shouldn't have drank all that lemonade.....The food was great and they offered a variety of local hot sauces to pack in a punch if you love some heat on your food like me.  The service was a little hit and miss. I found it rather slow at the beginning and felt like we were tucked away to a corner most of the time there. While it was nice to be by the bay window - it seemed like we were at a table on a lonely island. They did have patio seating, but nothing shaded which is why we opted to sit inside.  Overall cute breakfast spot and solid food options!
Great food that is not your average big vendor meat feel...more grass fed and all natural ingredients. Down to earth with amazing organic beers! Indoor and outdoor seating, and vegetarian options.
If you sit outside in the summer time you're surrounded by the veggies you're eating.
Amazing food and coffee.  Great service.
The IPA and Sweet Potato fries are fantastic!
Chicken, waffle, and eggs Benedict?! Who knew this combination of sweet/savory snd crunchy/smoothly deliciousness would forever change my definition of brunch? Divine. Majestic. I heart you.

The food here is really great. The sweet potato fries are perfect! They have some good beers here too, though might be worth trying before you commit. I wasn't a fan of all of them. Service was excellent, employees likes what they were doing, the music venue it awesome!! Do check it out. A bit expensive but you should expect that for the food quality.

The food was great. Being a vegetarian it's always hard to find somewhere my carnivore boyfriend and I both have plenty of options to choose from. Not the case here. It was difficult for me to choose so I ended up getting a few. The smoked gouda mac n cheese had great flavors and the risotto was pleasant as well. Thank you for a new favorite. Hopefully we'll be able to stop back again during this trip to Chicago.
Very cool place!
Great food!

We Came for a baby shower and the waitress was excellent!  I have a specific diet and she knew exactly what ingredients were in the food and told me right away what I could and couldn't eat. We enjoyed the food, a unique take on traditional American fare along with the outstanding service.  We will return!
The food is admittedly decent, but they recently lost a reservation that I had made over the phone, and were unaccommodating and unapologetic about it. I was pretty frustrated with the experience.

Total contrast from my last experience at the Devon lication (which was several months ago). Great Sunrise Sammy--tasty brioche bun, lovely fluffy eggs--and fresh squeezed OJ that was sweet and not very tart.

Came to Uncommon Ground for my friend's show last night, and unfortunately was never even allowed to see it.  I reserved a table for two, over the phone, over 24 hours in advance of the show. Was told, "once you show up, the price of your ticket will be added to your bill", cool, no problems.  The show "started" at 9, and I arrived at 9:17. If you've ever been to a live music show, starting on time never happens. My theory was accurate last night as well, as the show didn't start until 9:30....  This is where it gets fun. I was promptly told at the door that my reservation was given to someone else for being 17 min late. This gentleman's name was Kevin. Kevin said "you can wait around to see if more spots open up."  A little annoyed, but understanding, I waited around to hopefully get a spot. I sat and watched as Kevin promptly sat patrons who were over 1 HOUR to 90 minutes late.  Apparently, their policy is "make a reservation 24 hours in advance, if you don't show up exactly on time we give your spot away. BUT if you have a reservation and your full party isn't there, you can still show up an hour late and get right in." Makes sense.  I then politely asked the hostess (short curly blonde hair) about their reservation policy because it did not make much sense to me.  In an extremely condescending tone she said, "being 20 minutes late is an industry standard, you should know that". I stated I was disappointed I wouldn't get to see my friend play, and she replied (with obvious sarcasm) "I'm so sorry" and walked away.  I was pretty taken aback at the blatant rudeness and "different rules for different people" approach at this place. I'll never step foot in here again. Also, got the goat cheese/spinach artichoke dip and it looked and tasted like something you pick up in the frozen food section at Aldi. Save your money people.

I have been dining/drinking at Uncommon Ground from around the time they opened on the Grace Street location. I lived on Lakewood and Waveland from 1991 to 1995 and would stop by the 2 room restaurant after riding my Bike with friends. The restaurant had a large outdoor dining area from the time they opened around 1992.  I moved and purchased a condo at the Lake and Diversey and for reasons I'm unsure of I stoped going here for several years. Probably due to so many places to choose from near my condo. Although, there isn't one or even two casual dining spots with quality food, outdoor seating and music that even come close to the urban chic, yet casual ambiance offered by UG on Clark. I dined at the restaurant on Devon a few times and also my mom loved the Devon location plus we grew up right down the street and my Mom and dad cooked often so they loved that UG has a herb and vegetable garden on their "green" roof.  I'd say I frequented Devon more often during my mom's illness 2007 to 2011 as she enjoyed it there. We had her wake right across the street and I recall after the wake - the last night friends and I dined here.  I sold the condo after 14.5 years and developed an illness in 2015 so when I could venture out I'd head back to UG on Grace. My dad often dined with me. The place expanded, appears slightly more upscale and has taken over 3-4 rooms total but the food is as good as ever.  I started having lunch with my dad at UG on Grace as I returned to health. We'd always wonder if my dad's favorite server, Savanah, is working. She and dad both grew up in or near Tera Haute Indiana-which has its own fan base I learned and dad and Savanah spoke about this town which I'm certain I'm spelling wrong for over 1/2 hour. We learned that Savanah is an actress and my dad rents to an acting teacher who teaches an acting method familiar to Savanah. She's quite keen on taking lessons.  We also learned that on many of the days we keep Savanah from doing her job because we all love chatting so much- that the Cub's owners and management also enjoy her and didn't say one word when we were talking to her too long and the Cub's staff had to leave. That's classy.  The owner often chats with us and is friendly, down to earth and takes much pride in his great food.  The food is always made fresh daily, with some menu staples but also fresh changes regularly.  I love the chopped salad with salmon, the sweet potato fries, Asian spicy grilled calamari and all the soups - tomato and the cheddar broccoli. Vegan chili is also fantastic. Breakfast is always good. A bit pricy but worth it!
Great waiter who took great care of our party.  The food was great!  We will be back as a family.

We came here on November 11 for coffee.  I ordered a 16 oz. Americano and my son a 4 shot 8 oz. latte.  Assuming reasonable prices that should have totaled around $8 to $10 max, we were shocked at the $19 bill for two mediocre espresso drinks.  The Americano was around $3.50 or so - high but not unreasonable.  The 4 shot espresso latte was $15.50!!!  I complained to the manager who found the staff had overcharged but that espresso still came out to $10.50.  This was unquestionably the worst gouging I've experienced in 3 decades of ordering espresso drinks.  This place should get out of the espresso business until they educate themselves in the art and business of coffee.
A dream come true! Amazingly unique flavors and best experience.  Can't wait to try breakfast.
Fantastic.
Good beer but service was really slow, the window at our table was encrusted with gross splatters (inside of the window), and the air conditioning needed to be turned up, it was too warm.
I loved my vegan lunch at this place today!!
Very knowledgeable about their beer and excellent food. A bit pricey but worth it.

This was the second time I've been here. This was an even more pleasant experience and our waiter was extremely knowledgeable of the history of the restaurant as well as green star brewery. Yet Joseph told us this was only his second day working!  We ordered the cheese curds and two different beers that were brewed on-site. Both were delicious! Can't wait to come back and see the other beers they brew.
On game day, we came for an organic beer and enjoyed VERY good beer and VERY good service. We love this place.

DO NOT ORDER CALAMARI. Their calamari is basically just fried batter with Korean sauce. Didn't taste any squid and it didn't even seem like there was any in there. You get fried batter for 13$. Another thing that's absolutely stupid is that you're expected to tip for the musician coverage. We went there for a friend and the music and atmosphere is good, but the food is aweful.  We had some drinks and 3 meals, which was 40ish bucks, fine with tipping for that. But the food was bad except for the fish tacos. But on top of that it's 10$ coverage for the music each person, THAT YOU HAVE TO TIP FOR. I have never heard of tipping the server for the musicians playing.  Over priced mediocre food served to college kids who don't really get that they're getting ripped off. 13$ for "calamari" without any squid, 12 for bad macaroni and cheese.  Never ever going back there even if my friends perform there. One of the biggest rip offs I've run into in this city.

The brunch here is pretty good.  Sadly, it gets hot as hell inside.  We went twice.  The first time was outside, which was pleasant.  The second time, we were roasting in a full house.  It was so hot and uncomfortable, we had to escape back outside to breath.  At the bar, there's a few places in which the floor board lifts your stool up when someone walks by.  No complaints with the food, but it's not the best we've had and a little overpriced for what you get.  Again, it must be a common thing with this neighborhood, but staff just isn't that friendly.  Perhaps it's generational or just regional, but no one seems to really give a damn how you're doing or how the food is.  The other location is about the same.
Amazing service! Amazing food! Amazing Bloody Mary! Highly recommended!
Great atmosphere and even better service! This place is completely worth it.. They even have entertainment pretty much every night! Treat yourself.
This place goes up and down with their menu but the food is good I have always had a good meal and glass of wine here

Arrived to a completely empty location told that we couldn't even be accommodated at the bar by the host.  Stepped outside and called and told the complete opposite.  Needless to say disappointed and as regular visitors to the area will not come back.
This place has the BEST SALADS! Staff was friendly and gracious.
Very good, but a little high priced
Cool venue for small shows. The Cobb salad is a little overdone, simply too much, but was good. Beer selection is unique.
Great place for food, coffee, and live music.
Excellent wait staff and delicious food. Little on the pricey side but well worth it for the atmosphere and what you're getting.
Always a great meal.  I never remember what i had hear the time before and i think i might always get the same thing but its always good.
Expensive but very delicious food in a very nice atmosphere. I recommend having a drink and snack.
A little pricey but an excellent spot for vegans and carnivores alike to get a delicious meal. They're very eco conscious here and do what they can to have a sustainable operation.

Friendly service, amazing food, great beer selection, good mixed drinks. Atmosphere is cozy and homey.  Nice couches to sit around the fireplace, though if it's a busy night you'll have a hard time getting these seats. A tree up for Christmas, etc. The atmosphere is what really sells this place, but then I'm always pleasantly surprised by the quality of the food too. I love the big windows onto the street, makes this an especially nice place to have a drink when the weather is Chicago nasty outside.

This is one of my favorite restaurants in town. I found them through a Wired article. They grow most of their produce on-site and get their meats from Gunthorp Farms in Indiana. The owners home was also featured in the local green home tour in 2014.

Cool local menu that's always changing with what's available. Was able to get a few great beers and some excellent food before a Cubs game without the huge Wrigleyville crowds before a game. Helpful wait staff that knew the menu well.
Beautifully varied seasonal menu including seasonal drinks. The only time I've been (so far) was on a brisk fall evening and Uncommon Ground was extremely warm and inviting, cozy and friendly.

Nice and trendy! I really like the space and vibe; it kinda made me want to eat healthy. I went in for lunch with a group of seven, and we had no trouble finding a table. I was a little disappointed in my dish (Turkey burger), although the others' looked quite nice. It was just bland, and really didn't stick out as something memorable or something i couldn't make myself.  I'd give it a shot if you were in the market for a salad.
Well I should hate the damn place, as it was the last place that my ex Richard (Anthony) Flores and

Came from Michigan for a cubs game. Place was dead and service was very poor. Only seen staff like once and didn't seem to people person friendly. I love craft breweries and supporting them but this place needs to pay attention to their patrons
Excellent restaurant !
Their brunch is amazing.  It's slightly off the beaten path so the vibe here is much nicer than most of Wrigley also.  Everything is more local and tastes wonderful.

This used to be one of our favorite places, but it has really declined.  In our last trip for brunch I was served tepid food and we received mediocre service despite a relatively empty restaurant.  Given that the prices are on the higher side, I probably won't be going back.

I go there for the open mics. The food is OK but it's way overpriced. I guess it is all organic and what not. But the servers usually are pretty terrible anyways. Every time I go, it's like it's their first day! Same goes for the Devon location. Their beer is also just ok, needs work.

I met 3 friends for brunch on a Sunday at 10AM, it wasn't yet busy.  However, it took 15 minutes for me to get the chai latte that I ordered.  My friends arrived about 5 minutes after I did and it also took them forever to get their drinks.  We ordered breakfast at about 10:20 and it did not arrive until 10:50.  We weren't in a hurry, but it seems ridiculous given how slow it had been when we first arrived.  I had the Chilaquiles and my eggs were lukewarm, which basically meant they'd been sitting around while the other dishes were created.  The side potatoes were warm, crisp and tasty.  My friends ended up liking their egg sliders.  It ended up being ~$25 each.  We go out for breakfast once/month to a new place each time and there are plenty of good places.  So, considering the slow service and lukewarm food, I wasn't impressed, so won't be returning.
Awesome place.....great Music n food

I live in the neighborhood and liked this place before it went all "green and locally sourced".  I used to treat myself to a great burger - under $10 including sweet potato fries, lettuce, tomato, red onion, dijon mustard, etc.  AND a soft drink. They even managed to cook it rare, as ordered, more often than not. Last week I tried again - got a smaller burger, slightly overcooked, without tomato (not in season, locally)  and overcooked sweet potato fries (extra charge).  The bill with tip came to very bit of $20, with just tap water!   That's too much for a tomato-less, average-tasting  burger - no matter how organic and politically correct.  Let's get real!
Good food but even better atmosphere! Cozy fireplace up front and a nice bar. Unpretentious spot to catch up with family and friends.

Super cozy. Staff was friendly and helpful. We had the vegan chilaquiles and it was amazing! The chai here is a must. The only downside is that it's pretty limited on vegan breakfast options. Still so good!

Located across the street from Wrigley Field, it's an island of tranquility and organic eats in a neighborhood that would rather eat hot dogs at a sports bar. The menu changes seasonally but nearly everything I've had here was good, especially the brunch. In the summer snag a seat in their sidewalk patio and in the winter snuggle up with a drink in front of their large fireplace.

I'm a big fan of Uncommon Ground. I love the space and the food. Plus they often have live music and they are big supporters of sustainability and green movement. As a matter of fact, Uncommon Ground was the Country's First Certified Organic Roof Top Farm. Pretty cool.  I love that they offer a lot of vegetarian options and it seems like everything on their menu is tasty. The cocktails are just as good, too.
username: NowYouKnow Events, Chicago's Best Event Calendar

caption: Service was friendly but it took an extremely long time to get our food. It was a bit strange being that it wasn't all that busy, although even the host seemed overwhelmed, despite the fact that the place was half empty. The food quite good. Everyone in our group enjoyed their meal and the portions are pretty hearty. I wouldn't go out of my way to return but if I'm in the area, I'd def come back.

I stopped at Uncommon Ground when I was passing through on a  Sunday afternoon.  The menu is definitely steered more towards a vegetarian audience.  For lunch I decided when in Rome, do as the Romans do.  I went with the vegetarian chili and the tomato sandwich.  The chili was hearty and wholesome.   I am usually an omnivore and I prefer a chili that is light on the beans, but in spite of that it was flavorful, and slightly acidic with a nice bite of spice.  I also ended up enjoying the tomato sandwich.  It was a nice combination that used fresh heirloom tomatoes alongside fried green tomatoes.  The winner in the dish was the aoli that brought the dish together.  The only criticism I have is that it was a bit difficult to eat,  even with the giant toothpick holding things together, the layers of the  sandwich were slipping all over the place.  I don't mind that much because messy sandwiches are some of the best you can have.
Easily one of my favorite restaurants and bars in the city. They believe in cooking with local ingredients and their brunch is a must.
I didn't think a tomato sandwhich could be so good.  Great outdoor seating

I have never had a bad experience at Uncommon Ground. The staff is always friendly, quick and efficient, the food is top notch, local and seasonal, and the atmosphere is relaxed and comfy. I love going in the colder months for their hearty pumpkin ravioli and a great glass of wine or a mug of their chai next to the fireplace. It's good for groups or for an quiet evening with a friend. I keep going back and am never disappointed.
Delicious breakfast nachos and mac n cheese!! It has a lovely patio for drinks and martini mondays!
Delicious food, and a fun place to take visitors because all the food comes from a 300 mile radius of the restaurant location. Definitely recommend!

This place. although slightly overpriced, is one I would recommend for one who is mostly vegetarian to go to, but there are foods on their menu that would appeal to vegans. What strikes me about this location is their Vegetarian Chili. Not only are the staff welcoming and friendly (they got me a new glass of water after I spilled the original glass!), they're very attentive - especially when it's not busy.

Uncommon Ground is a very unique place to enjoy music and great food. I first visited Uncommon Ground for a concert put on by a friend of mine. The setting was very small, but that added to the uniqueness. I would highly recommend.

Uncommon Ground has to really cute, really convienient locations in Wrigleyville and Edgewater/Rogers Park and they pride themselves on serving food from local farms. I love the fact that you are informed of where exactly your food is coming from. The atmosphere is comfortable and chic and the service is always great! They have a really great Mac and Cheese dish and some amazing cocktails!
Delicious and high quality ingredients. Loved sitting out on the patio under their charming lights and enjoying a meal with great friends. Live band was there also, awesome time!

A decent list of draft and bottled beer. The flights of draft beer make for an interesting trial tasting. I had the brewery vivant triomphe, solemn oath Oxford comma, off color troublesome, metropolitan flywheel zwichelbier, tight head hat trick, and the virtue sidra de nava.  I liked the Oxford comm and flywheel the best as they had the most flavor. I would not get the triomphe and cider again.  The food is pretty tasty. The bar has a decent location and set-up but I probably won't go back unless my companions want to. It's good, but I'd rather try something new.

One of the better breakfast places in wrigleyville, or the city for that matter. They have all fresh ingredients and really knock breakfast out of the park. It's a great place to go early, sit outside, eat and people watch. I would strongly recommend you try this if you are in the area or even close. It's awesome.
Great local food. they do a wonderful job of being environmentally concious. Also the infused bourbon with rosemary is delicious!

used to live right across the street from here and all i can say about that situation is,... it was dangerous for my wallet.  Still frequent this place when im in the neighborhood though.  Great farm to table food... especially in the summer (When they take their fresh grown herbs from their roof and put it right on your plate).  Creative seasonal dishes with great weekly drink specials.  If you are into organic farm to tables, this is a must visit.

I have walked passed this place hundreds of times and always looked inside and wondered what it was all about. I finally went in with my boyfriend and found out what it was all about. They have all locally grown produce and beer. My favorite item off the menu is the chicken sandwich and their steak is also to die for. For appetizers I love the spinach and goat cheese dip. They have great service but sometimes their staff can be a bit slow.
The vegan black bean burger was excellent. I will return. Great experience.
This is an amaizng spot for brunch...on of my favorites in the city!  Always have fresh food and change the menu every once in awhile for new plates.  Added bonus is live music in the evening.
I love their food and their drinks but it's a bit pricey for us to go there as often as we wished. :( . A fun and friendly place to take your friends from out of town. Highly recommended
One of our favorite restaurants.  great food, great drink, and great music/art to boot.  We especially like the breakfast/brunch menu.  Best chilaquiles in town!
Best Brunch Ever! Definitely get an espresso based drink :)
Cool place. Speciality beers. Interesting menu. Middle to high meal prices. Great atmosphere.

The Wrigleyville outpost of Uncommon Ground has a much different vibe from the Edgewater location, but is equally enjoyable.  The menu is often identical, but can feature slight differences--so it's worth visiting both and deciding which location you prefer.  Of course, both honor the same principle of serving locally sourced, responsibly raised food at a reasonable price.  Makes you wonder why more places don't do this...?
The food was awesome, decor was o.k., very warm and friendly place to eat dinner. We will most definitely go there again.

The epitome of fresh, organic, natural, and delicious food and drinks. If I had the money I'd eat here more often. Just don't show up for open mic night unless you want to hear an acoustic song about Iowa from some girl waiting for her friends to show up so she can play it again.
Everytime I've gone there something horrific happened involving service. The food is good and it's hip and fun.
Great place with organic food!

Soooooo GOOOOOOD!!! Delicious! You can actually taste the food is very fresh! Its comes from their own rooftop organic garden!  For steak lovers, they offer grass-fed beef steak.  For Italian dish, my favorite all-time pasta, the pumpkin ravioli (creamy sage butter, gorgonzola, hazelnuts) is yummilicious!!  For veggie lovers, there's lots of great delicious options! Such as Veggie Chili, Quinoa Stuffed Squash, Organic black bean cake, and more!!  I love the sweet potatoes with goat cheese fondue! Brunch is fantastic gourmet organic healthy food. So much more to check out! This location is cozy with a fireplace for drinks or go to other room to listen to live music.  Definitely a romantic spot!
great organic food..awesome atmosphere

//Food// Excellent, particularly the Uncommon Chopped Salad and the Uncommon Burger. With the latter, the chef tends to over-rarify, so I'd recommend opting for medium if you typically like your meat medium-rare. Nice, but pricey, cocktails.  //Decor// Yes; the low lights are conducive to a romantic weeknight out, and the solid brick walls are conducive to a fun night out with 6 to 8 people. The fireplace(s) are ablaze in the winter months, increasing the restaurant's cozy quotient.  //Service// In the "lacking" to "awful" range. Grumpy waitresses who connive behind the bar, chatting with the other staff about their fun plans for the weekend. I've had confrontational servers here, ones who've made mistakes and angrily blamed the patron. I've also had a waitress who forgot to submit our order to the kitchen -- the food arrived an hour and forty-five minutes after we had ordered it. On these occasions, the manager on-site (a short fellow who prefers sweater vests, and resembles a pre-Rings Elijah Wood if you're squinting) has been defensive, doubtful, and incompetent at addressing the complaint at hand. The service here must be a shtick for a performance piece the staff are working on: can't wait for opening night!
A little pricey, but definitely worth making a trip over here if you're in Wrigleyville.  It has a cool atmosphere, nice to sit outside. You can bring dogs.
I went here last week for the first time and I realized I had been missing out.  Its located close to Wrigley Field.  It has a great fresh menu with a "farm to table" type of feel.

Some friends and I tried out Uncommon Ground for dinner and it was fantastic!  We sat on their sidewalk patio and it had a wonderful ambiance, a perfect place to enjoy a relaxing meal in the summer.  We tried a variety of things at our table: avocado tempura tacos, chili, goat cheese dip and the tomato sandwich with sweet potato fries. I must say that everything was delicious except the chili which was extremely bland.  My favorites were the tempura tacos and the dip. I'd highly recommend either of them.  The drink menu was great as well and we enjoyed an array of cocktails and beer - none of which disappointed.  Definitely check out Uncommon Ground if you have the chance!

Delicious food made with a lot of organic ingredients. The food is a bit pricey, but is totally worth it. The drinks are different and delicious. The best time to go here is during the cooler months, because it has a great, cozy atmosphere. Great for brunch too!
check out the rooftop garden if you can!

I have had a great experience here every time I have gone to Uncommon Ground. The food is terrific and the service is top notch. It's a great place for date or small group gathering. The atmosphere is warm and cozy and will make you feel like you're at home.
I loved the sweet potato fries. The rest was so-so but I was more into those fries than anything.
Started going to Uncommon Ground shortly after they opened almost 19 years ago. Great people, great food.

three words: sweet potato fries! 6 of us showed up for a late lunch on friday afternoon, were seated immediately, and proceeded to have some incredibly awesome food! service was on the spot, not too overbearing but left nothing to be desired. they've got a lot of menu items with goat cheese, and all of the ones we tried were outstanding. but the sweet potato fries were absolutely worth going for, if nothing else!
